advancements.lightmanscurrency.ancient_c: Find an ancient coin in a suspicious area
advancements.lightmanscurrency.atm.descr: Craft an ATM Machine. You can use this to manually exchange coins and access your bank accounts
advancements.lightmanscurrency.atm.title: Now you're thinking with Banking
advancements.lightmanscurrency.banker_tr: Buy a currency-related item from a banker
advancements.lightmanscurrency.cash_regi: Craft a cash register so that players can interact with all of your nearby traders at once!
advancements.lightmanscurrency.cashier_t: Buy something for coins from a cashier
advancements.lightmanscurrency.coin_mint: Craft a Coin Mint so that you can mint your own coins
advancements.lightmanscurrency.enchanted: Enchant your wallet with the Coin Magnet enchantment
advancements.lightmanscurrency.event.cho: Play during a special holiday! Unlocks the ability to use chocolate coins as money
advancements.lightmanscurrency.event.chr: Played during a very jolly time!
advancements.lightmanscurrency.event.val: Played during the celebration of love
advancements.lightmanscurrency.jar_of_su: WHY DID IT HAVE TO BE SOUP!?
advancements.lightmanscurrency.nether_st: Craft a wallet from a nether star. Only for those with a true need for coin storage!
advancements.lightmanscurrency.netherite: Craft a netherite wallet, one of the largest and most resilient wallets around!
advancements.lightmanscurrency.network_t: Craft a network trader so that you can sell your items to anyone, anywhere!
advancements.lightmanscurrency.root.desc: Collecting wealth and trading with players
advancements.lightmanscurrency.specialty: Craft a specialty item trader. Be careful, as they have special rules limiting how their trades are defined
Craft a Trading Terminal. This will let you access network traders from anywhere
advancements.lightmanscurrency.trader.de: Craft any Trader so that you can trade with your friends!
advancements.lightmanscurrency.trader_in: Craft a trader interface so that you can automate trading or restocking with a network trader!
advancements.lightmanscurrency.trading_c: Craft a Trading Core! These are needed to make trading machines to trade from
advancements.lightmanscurrency.wallet_cr: Craft your first wallet. You can use these to store your coins!

command.lightmanscurrency.ticket.color.n: You must be holding a valid ticket to change its color
Whether the 'Move Coins into Wallet' button should collect coins from a side-chain.
By default these would be the coin pile and coin block variants of the coins.
Whether the 'Move Coins into Wallet' button will appear in the top-right corner of the Chest Screen if there are coins in the chest that can be collected.
Whether LC screens should render a white background for easier debugging & screenshots
Mostly used for creating wiki/guidebook content
The position that the notification & team manager buttons will be placed at in the players inventory.
The position that the notification & team manager buttons will be placed at in the creative players inventory.
The maximum number of columns the Network Terminal is allowed to display
The default sorting mode that will be automatically selected when you first open the terminal
Note: The game will remember your last selection option within the same session, so editing this after the screen has been opened will not change anything until you close and re-open your game.
The maximum number of rows the Network Terminal is allowed to display
A default search filter that will be automatically added to the search parameters
Whether notifications should be posted in your in-game chat when you receive them.
Contains settings related to increasing or lowering rendering quality to help improve FPS in areas with a lot of machines.
Whether the Gacha Ball should render the item inside
Enabling will double the number of items being rendered, and can cause FPS issues near Gacha Machines if their fancy graphics are enabled
Whether the Gacha Machine will render each Gacha Ball individually
Disable if you're having FPS issues near the Gacha Machine, this will make the machine render a far more simplisitic representation of its contents.
A list of item ids or item tags that should be rendered by Item Traders at a different scale.
Maximum number of items each Item Trader can renderBG (per-trade) as stock. Lower to decrease client-lag in trader-rich areas.
Setting to 0 will disable item rendering entirely, so use with caution.
The number of Minecraft ticks the slot machine animation will last.
Note: 20 ticks = 1 second
Must be at least 20 ticks (1s) for coding reasons.
The number of Minecraft ticks the slot machine will pause before repeating the animation.
Whether the Money Mending enchantment should make a noise when triggered.
Whether you should recieve a message in chat whenever you place a machine in an area that another player is taxing
Whether you should recieve a message in chat whenever you place a machine when server-wide taxes are enabled
How Notification Timestamps are displayed.
Follows SimpleDateFormat formatting: https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/text/SimpleDateFormat.html
The corner of the screen that the overlay should be drawn on.
The distance/offset from the corner that the overlay will be drawn at.
The method that should be used to draw the contents.
Whether an overlay should be drawn on your HUD displaying your equipped wallets current contents.
Does nothing when Curios is installed.
0 0 is the top-left corner of the menu, with x moving it further right and y moving it further down
The position of "Open Wallet" button relative to the wallet slot.
The position of the wallet slot in the players creative inventory menu.
The position of the wallet slot in the players inventory menu.
Whether the Impactor compat will be initialized.
Requires a full reboot for changes to be applied!
/reload required for any changes made here to take effect.
Disabling will not remove any existing items/blocks from the world, nor prevent their use.
Whether ATM Cards can be crafted.
Whether Auction Stand blocks can be crafted.
Whether Network Traders can be crafted.
Disabling does NOT disable the recipes of Network Upgrades or the Trading Terminals.
Whether Tax Collector blocks can be crafted.
Whether Trader Interface blocks can be crafted.
Whether the Coin Mint machine can be crafted.
Whether or not built-in coin mint recipes that turn coins back into resources will be loaded.
Whether or not built-in coin mint recipes that turn resources into coins will be loaded.
Does nothing if "Can Melt Coins" is already false/disabled.
Whether the default mint recipe to melt copper coins back into copper ingots will be loaded.
Whether the default mint recipe to melt diamond coins back into diamonds will be loaded.
Whether the default mint recipe to melt emerald coins back into emeralds will be loaded.
Whether the default mint recipe to melt gold coins back into gold ingots will be loaded.
Whether the default mint recipe to melt iron coins back into iron ingots will be loaded.
Whether the default mint recipe to melt netherite coins back into netherite ingots will be loaded.
Does nothing if "Can Mint Coins" is already false/disabled.
Whether the default mint recipe to mint copper coins from copper ingots will be loaded.
Whether the default mint recipe to mint diamond coins from diamonds will be loaded.
Whether the default mint recipe to mint emerald coins from emeralds will be loaded.
Whether the default mint recipe to mint gold coins from gold ingots will be loaded.
Whether the default mint recipe to mint iron coins from iron ingots will be loaded.
Whether the default mint recipe to mint netherite coins from netherite ingots will be loaded.
Whether the Money Chest Bank Upgrade can be crafted.
Whether the Money Chest can be crafted.
Disabling does NOT disable the recipes of Money Chest Upgrades.
Whether the Money Chest Exchange Upgrade can be crafted.
Whether the Money Chest Magnet Upgrades can be crafted.
Whether the Money Chest Security Upgrade can be crafted.
Level of debug messages to be shown in the logs.
0-All debug messages. 1-Warnings/Errors only. 2-Errors only. 3-No debug messages.
Note: All debug messages will still be sent debug.log regardless of settings.
Whether the Chocolate Event Coins will be added to the coin data.
Note: Disabling will not remove any Chocolate Coin items that already exist, this simply makes them no longer function as money
Whether custom events can replace a portion (or all) of the default loot with custom event loot.
Whether custom events defined in the 'SeasonalEvents.json' config can give players the one-time reward for logging in during the event.
Whether coins can spawn in chests.
List of Loot Tables that will also spawn loot from the "lightmanscurrency:loot_addons/chest/tier1" loot table.
List of Loot Tables that will also spawn loot from the "lightmanscurrency:loot_addons/chest/tier2" loot table.
List of Loot Tables that will also spawn loot from the "lightmanscurrency:loot_addons/chest/tier3" loot table.
List of Loot Tables that will also spawn loot from the "lightmanscurrency:loot_addons/chest/tier4" loot table.
List of Loot Tables that will also spawn loot from the "lightmanscurrency:loot_addons/chest/tier5" loot table.
List of Loot Tables that will also spawn loot from the "lightmanscurrency:loot_addons/chest/tier6" loot table.
Whether modded machines that emulate player behaviour can trigger coin drops from entities.
Set to false to help prevent autmated coin farming.
Whether coins can be dropped by entities that were spawned by the vanilla spawner.
Whether coins can be dropped by entities.
Accepts the following inputs:
Entity IDs. e.g. "minecraft:cow"
Entity Tags. e.g. "#minecraft:skeletons"
Every entity provided by a mod. e.g. "minecraft:*"
Note: If an entity meets multiple criteria, it will drop the lowest tier loot that matches (starting with normal T1 -> T6 then boss T1 -> T6)
List of Entities that will drop loot from the "lightmanscurrency:loot_addons/boss/tier1" loot table.
Does NOT require a player kill to trigger coin drops.
List of Entities that will drop loot from the "lightmanscurrency:loot_addons/boss/tier2" loot table.
Does NOT require a player kill to trigger coin drops.
List of Entities that will drop loot from the "lightmanscurrency:loot_addons/boss/tier3" loot table.
Does NOT require a player kill to trigger coin drops.
List of Entities that will drop loot from the "lightmanscurrency:loot_addons/boss/tier4" loot table.
Does NOT require a player kill to trigger coin drops.
List of Entities that will drop loot from the "lightmanscurrency:loot_addons/boss/tier5" loot table.
Does NOT require a player kill to trigger coin drops.
List of Entities that will drop loot from the "lightmanscurrency:loot_addons/boss/tier6" loot table.
Does NOT require a player kill to trigger coin drops.
List of Entities that will drop loot from the "lightmanscurrency:loot_addons/entity/tier1" loot table.
Requires a player kill to trigger coin drops.
List of Entities that will drop loot from the "lightmanscurrency:loot_addons/entity/tier2" loot table.
Requires a player kill to trigger coin drops.
List of Entities that will drop loot from the "lightmanscurrency:loot_addons/entity/tier3" loot table.
Requires a player kill to trigger coin drops.
List of Entities that will drop loot from the "lightmanscurrency:loot_addons/entity/tier4" loot table.
Requires a player kill to trigger coin drops.
List of Entities that will drop loot from the "lightmanscurrency:loot_addons/entity/tier5" loot table.
Requires a player kill to trigger coin drops.
List of Entities that will drop loot from the "lightmanscurrency:loot_addons/entity/tier6" loot table.
Requires a player kill to trigger coin drops.
Tier 1 loot item.
Applies to loot table loot type "lightmanscurrency:configured_item" with "tier":1, which is used in all "lightmanscurrency:loot_addons" loot tables configured below.
Tier 2 loot item.
Applies to loot table loot type "lightmanscurrency:configured_item" with "tier":2, which is used in all "lightmanscurrency:loot_addons" loot tables configured below.
Tier 3 loot item.
Applies to loot table loot type "lightmanscurrency:configured_item" with "tier":3, which is used in all "lightmanscurrency:loot_addons" loot tables configured below.
Tier 4 loot item.
Applies to loot table loot type "lightmanscurrency:configured_item" with "tier":4, which is used in all "lightmanscurrency:loot_addons" loot tables configured below.
Tier 5 loot item.
Applies to loot table loot type "lightmanscurrency:configured_item" with "tier":5, which is used in all "lightmanscurrency:loot_addons" loot tables configured below.
Tier 6 loot item.
Applies to loot table loot type "lightmanscurrency:configured_item" with "tier":6, which is used in all "lightmanscurrency:loot_addons" loot tables configured below.
Whether coins given to a player with the /give command should be intercepted by the players wallet if one is equipped
Whether coins give to the player via Forges ItemHandlerHelper utilities should be intercepted by the players wallet if one is equipped
Requires a /reload command to be applied correctly
Whether new structures will have a chance to spawn in ancient cities
Whether new special structures designed for Integrated Dungeons and Structures compatibility can spawn
Does nothing if IDAS is not installed
Whether new village structures will have a chance to spawn in vanilla villages
Note: Any changes to villagers requires a full reboot to be applied due to how Minecraft/Forge registers trades.
Whether the banker villager profession (ATM) will have any registered trades.
The banker sells Lightman's Currency items for coins.
Whether the cashier villager profession (Cash Register) will have any registered trades.
The cashier sells an amalgamation of vanilla traders products for coins.
Whether the wandering trader will have additional trades that allow you to buy misc items with money.
Note: Changes made only apply to newly generated trades. Villagers with trades already defined will not be changed.
Whether vanilla villagers added by other mods should have the Emeralds from their trades replaced with coins.
Whether vanilla villagers should have the Emeralds from their trades replaced with coins.
Whether the wandering trader should have the emeralds from their trades replaced with the default replacement coin.
The default coin to replace a trades emeralds with.
List of replacement coin overrides for each villager profession.
Whether Piglins will accept gold coins as a valid bartering item
The percentage of the final bid that will be collected as a fee instead of being given to the auctions owner when the auction is completed
A flat fee paid on the creation of an auction by the player submitting it
If they are unable to pay this fee, they will not be able to submit any auctions
Whether players are allowed to bid on an auction when they were also the previous bidder
Whether the Auction House will be automatically generated and accessible.
If disabled after players have interacted with it, items & money in the auction house cannot be accessed until re-enabled.
If disabled, it is highly recommended that you also disable the Crafting -> Auction Stand option in the common config.
The maxumim number of day an auction can have its duration set to.
The minimum number of days an auction can have its duration set to.
If given a 0 day minimum, the minimum auction duration will be 1 hour.
Whether the players are allowed to bid on their own Auctions
The maximum number of pending auctions each player is allowed to have
Set to 0 to only allow auctions to be posted by admins in LC Admin Mode, or to limit the Auction House to only Persistent Auctions
Whether the auction fees collected should be stored in the server-wide tax collector as taxes
Includes both the submission fee and the fee taken from the final bid
Useful for those who wish to keep track of auction fees collected, and/or don't want money to destroyed in this process
Whether the Auction House will appear in the trading terminal.
If false, you will only be able to access the Auction House from an Auction Stand.
Whether interest applied to small amounts of money are guaranteed to give at least *some* money as long as there's money in the account.
Example 1% interest applied to a bank account with only 1 copper coin will always give *at least* 1 copper coin.
The interest rate that bank accounts will earn just by existing.
Setting to 0 will disable interest and all interest-related ticks from happening.
Note: Rate of 1.0 will result in doubling the accounts money each interest tick.
Rate of 0.01 is equal to a 1% interest rate.
A list of Money Value unique ids that should not have interest applied to them.
Example:
Adding "lightmanscurrency:coins!chocolate_coins" will prevent chocolate coins from getting interest,
Adding "lightmanscurrency:coins!*" will prevent all built-in money types from getting interest
The number of minecraft ticks that will pass before interest is applied.
Helpful Notes:
1s = 20 ticks
1m = 1200 ticks
1h = 72000 ticks
1 day = 1728000 ticks
1 week = 12096000 ticks
30 days = 51840000 ticks
365 days = 630720000 ticks
Whether players will receive a personal notification whenever their bank account collects interest.
Regardless of this value, the bank accounts logs will always display the interest interaction.
A list of upper interest limits.
Example:
Adding "1n" to this list will make it so that players will get no more than 1 netherite coin worth of interest even if they would normally get more.
Whether the Chocolate Coins will give players custom potion and/or healing effects on consumption.
Default number of ticks it takes to process a Coin Mint recipe.
Does not apply to Coin Mint recipes with a defined "duration" input.
The volume of the noise played whenever the Coin Mint finishes the crafting process.
The maximum permission level that can be set and used by a command trader
The permission level required to place the command trader block
Settings for compatbility with FTB Chunks, Cadmus, and Flan
Whether the `/lcclaims buy claim` command will be accessible to players.
Whether the `/lcclaims buy forceload` command will be accessible to players.
The price per claim chunk purchased.
Blocks that will be added with each 'claim' purchased
The price per forceload chunk purchased.
The maximum number of extra claim chunks allowed to be purchased with this command.
Note: This count includes extra claim chunks given to the player/team via normal FTB Chunks methods as well (if applicable).
The maximum number of extra forceload chunks allowed to be purchased with this command.
Note: This count includes extra forceload chunks given to the player/team via normal FTB Chunks methods as well (if applicable).
The coin collection radius of the Coin Magnet I enchantment.
The final level of Coin Magnet that will result in increased range calculations.
Increase if you have another mod that increases the max level of the Coin Magnet enchantment
and you wish for those levels to actually apply an effect.
The increase in the coin collection radius added by each additional level of the Coin Magnet enchantment.
The additional cost to repair an item with Infinity applied to it.
The cost required to repair a single item durability point with the Money Mending enchantment.
The delay (in ticks) between Money Mending & Coin Magnet ticks.
Increase if my enchantments are causing extreme lag.
Note: 20 ticks = 1s
Whether block break protection will be disabled completely.
Enable with caution as this will allow players to grief and rob other players shops and otherwise protected machinery.
A list of dimension ids that are quarantined from all cross-dimensional interactions.
This includes disabling Trader Interfaces, Network Traders & Terminals (personal trader interactions & cash registers will still function), and all Bank Account access.

Mostly intended to be used to allow the existence of 'Creative Dimensions' where money can be cheated in by your average player, but should not affect a players inventory/bank balance in the 'normal' dimensions.

Whether illegally broken traders (such as being replaced with /setblock, or modded machines that break blocks) will safely eject their block/contents into a temporary storage area for the owner to collect safely.
If disabled, illegally broken traders will throw their items on the ground, and can thus be griefed by modded machines.
Value ignored if anarchyMode is enabled!
A list of Model Variant ids that will be hidden from the Variant Select Menu on the client, and cannot be selected in said menu.
The additional Attack Damage added by each additional size (up to a size of 3)
The additional Attack Speed added by each additional size (up to a size of 3)
Is negative because you typically want to make weapons such as these attack slower
Note: If the total attack speed additions are more than -4.0, the player will be unable to get a full-strength attack with that size of Money Bag.
The base Attack Damage that an empty Money Bag will have (not counting the base 1 attack damage the player has)
The base Attack Speed that an empty Money Bag will have (not counting the base 4 attack speed the player has)
Is negative because you typically want to make weapons such as these attack slower (vanilla sword attack speed is 1.5, which can be obtained with a value of -2.5)
The base fall damage per distance an empty Money Bag will have
The base upper limit for fall damage that an empty Money Bag will have
The chance of the Money Bag dropping a random coin when it's used to attack another entity or when it falls a significant distance
0.0 is a 0% chance, and 1.0 is a 100% chance
The minimum distance a Money Bag must fall before it has a chance to drop coins when it lands
The additional upper limit for fall damage added by each additional size (up to a size of 3)
The additional fall damage per distance added by each additional size (up to a size of 3)
The maximum number of notifications each player and/or machine can have before old entries are deleted.
Lower if you encounter packet size problems.
The maximum number of ticks that a paygate can be set to output a redstone signal for.
The maximum distance allowed between players in order for a player trade to persist.
-1 will always allow trading regardless of dimension.
0 will allow infinite distance but require that both players be in the same dimension.
Whether Tax Collectors can only be activated by an Admin in LC Admin Mode.
Will not prevent players from crafting, placing, or configuring Tax Collectors.
The maximum height of a Tax Collectors area in meters.
The maximum radius of a Tax Collectors area in meters.
The maximum tax rate (in %) a Tax Collector is allowed to enforce.
Note: The sum of multiple tax collectors rates can still exceed this number.
If a machine reaches a total tax rate of 100% it will forcibly prevent all monetary interactions until this is resolved.
The maximum vertical offset of a Tax Collectors area in meters.
Note: Vertical offset can be negative, so this will also enforce the lowest value.
Whether the /lcterminal command will exist allowing players to access the Trading Terminal without the physical item/block
Whether Traders with no defined Custom Name will be sorted to the bottom of the Trader list on the Network Terminal.
The amount of bonus selections added by the Interaction Upgrade (Emerald)
The amount of bonus selections added by the Interaction Upgrade (Diamond)
The amount of bonus selections added by the Interaction Upgrade (Netherite)
The amount of item storage added by the Item Capacity Upgrade (Iron)
The amount of item storage added by the Item Capacity Upgrade (Gold)
The amount of item storage added by the Item Capacity Upgrade (Diamond)
The amount of item storage added by the Item Capacity Upgrade (Netherite)
The radius (in meters) of the Money Chest Magnet Upgrade (Copper)'s coin collection.
The radius (in meters) of the Money Chest Magnet Upgrade (Iron)'s coin collection.
The radius (in meters) of the Money Chest Magnet Upgrade (Gold)'s coin collection.
The radius (in meters) of the Money Chest Magnet Upgrade (Emerald)'s coin collection.
Whether wallets can have additional slots added by using an upgrade item on them from their inventory
By default diamonds are the only valid upgrade item, but this can be changed by a datapack
The lowest level wallet capable of allowing transfers to/from your bank account.
The lowest level wallet capable of exchanging coins.
Whether Wallet Drops should be manually spawned into the world instead of the default behaviour of being passed to the PlayerDropsEvent
Wallet Drops will be either the Wallet itself, or the coins dropped when the `coinDropPercent` game rule is greater than 0.
The lowest level wallet capable of automatically collecting coins while equipped.
create.item_attributes.lightmanscurrency: Does not have the Model Variant '%s'
Does not have any Model Variant
Is a Wallet that can access your bank accounts
Is not a Wallet that can access your bank accounts
Is a Wallet that can exchange coins
Is not a Wallet that can exchange coins
Is a Wallet that can pick up coins
Is not a Wallet that can pick up coins

permission.lightmanscurrency.addRemoveAl: Allows the player to add or remove other players (or themselves) from the list of Allies
permission.lightmanscurrency.allowExtern: Allows the player to give external devices, such as computers, ally or admin permissions for automation purposes
permission.lightmanscurrency.bankLink.to: Allows the player to enable or disable the 'Link to Bank Account' setting
permission.lightmanscurrency.breakTrader: Allows the player to break the machine in the world. Also required to pick up the trader as an item to be moved elsewhere
permission.lightmanscurrency.changeExter: Allows the player to change which sides of the machine can have product inserted or extracted from them
Allows player to change the traders display name & custom icon
permission.lightmanscurrency.collectCoin: Allows the player to collect money from this traders internal money storage
permission.lightmanscurrency.editPermiss: Allows the player to edit the permissions exactly as you are
permission.lightmanscurrency.editSetting: Allows the player to access most settings in the main Settings tab. Required for players to utilize other settings-related permissions (like the Display Settings permission)
permission.lightmanscurrency.editTradeRu: Allows the player to activate, deactivate, and otherwise edit the Trade Rules attached to this trader or its trades (Edit Trades permissions required to edit Trade-Specific rules)
Allows player to create remove and modify the trades
permission.lightmanscurrency.interaction: Allows the player to set up a Trader Interface that can automatically restock and/or drain product from this machines storage
permission.lightmanscurrency.openStorage: Allows player to access the Storage Menu and add or remove items from the traders storage.
Allows the player to store money to this traders internal money storage
permission.lightmanscurrency.transferOwn: Allows the player to change the owner of this machine to any valid player or team
permission.lightmanscurrency.viewLogs.to: Allows the player to view this machines interaction logs
resourcepack.lightmanscurrency.closer_it: Draws Item Trader stock items closer together in-world.
resourcepack.lightmanscurrency.fancy_ico: Replaces coins initials with fancy icons in menus/tooltips
resourcepack.lightmanscurrency.legacy_co: Replaces coins with the original textures
resourcepack.lightmanscurrency.rupees.de: Replaces the LC coins with rupees
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.atm.1: Can exchange coins for other coins of higher or lower values
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.atm.2: Can deposit or withdraw coins from any bank account you have access to
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.atm.3: Can transfer money from your account to another player or teams account
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.atm.key_bind: Press [%s] while equipped to access the ATM
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.atm_card.lock: Will close the menu and permanently lock this cards selected account!
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.atm_card.not_l: Not yet linked to a bank account
Will make all ATM Cards linked to this bank account no longer function until re-assigned
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.beta: Feature in beta stage. May have issues!
Can be used to link and interact with multiple local traders from the same menu
Crouch & Interact with a trader to register
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.coin_jar.2: When placed, up to 64 coins can be inserted by interacting with the jar while holding a coin
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.coin_jar.3: If mined with silk touch the jar will drop with the coins still inside
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.coin_jar.4: If mined without silk touch the jar will break and its contents will be dropped instead
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.coin_jar.color: Can be dyed in a crafting table
Gacha Machine is not set up yet
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.interface.item: Can be used to automatically purchase or sell items from any network item trader
Can be used to automatically drain or restock items remotely to/from any item trader you have access to
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.interface.onli: On even if Owner is Offline
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.money_bag.1: When placed, up to 576 coins can be inserted by interacting with the bag while holding a coin
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.money_bag.2: Interacting with the bag with an empty hand will extract a random coin from the bag
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.money_bag.3: When mined the bag will drop with the coins still inside
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.money_bag.4: Bag increases in size the more coins are contained within
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.money_bag.5: In a pinch a sufficiently full bag can be used as a blunt weapon
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.ownable.anarch: Server is in Anarchy Mode. Block will not be break-protected!
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.owner_mode.man: Switch to Manual Player Input Mode
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.pass: Will not be instantly consumed by Paygates
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.paygate.2: Can be used to trigger a redstone signal for a price
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.paygate.3: Can be linked to a ticket for easier customer interactions
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.payment_card.u: Can be placed in a traders money slots to be used as payment
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.persistent.add: Create a Persistent Auction with the given data
Create a Persistent Trader with a copy of this traders trades & name.
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.slot_machine.u: Slot Machine is not yet set up!
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.smithing_templ: Redstone or Copper to Netherite Materials
Can be placed and used to collect taxes from trader sales within an area
Can only be activated by an admin!
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.team.name: Name
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.terminal.1: Can access Network Traders remotely from any location
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.terminal.key_b: Press [%s] while equipped to access the terminal
Can be used to print unique Master and Slave tickets
Tickets can be used with the Paygate, or used as coupons for barter trades
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.trade.item.nbt: NBT is NOT enforced. Item may have unexpected NBT data
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.trade.item.shi: Hold SHIFT & Click to access Item Settings
Click with a Master Ticket to accept Tickets as payment
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.trade_rule.dai: Forgets each players progress through the trade list, resetting them back to the initial trade
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.trade_rule.fre: Forgets who has received their free sample(s) so that they may receive it again
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.trade_rule.pla: Clears the memory of how many trades have been handled
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.trader.auction: Will cancel the auction. The latest bid will be refunded, and your items will be returned to your inventory
Will cancel the auction. The latest bid will be refunded, and your items will be sent to your storage
%s%% of the final bid will be collected as a fee for using the auction house
You cannot submit more than %1$s auctions at once
If enabled, any bids made within the last 5 minutes of the auctions timer will reset the remaining time to bid back to 5m.
Enable if you wish to avoid last second bid-snatching
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.trader.command: Can be used to execute commands for a price
Permission level can be customized in trader settings within the upper limit defined in the server config
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.trader.gacha_m: Can be used to sell a single random item from its storage at a predefined price
Unlike the slot machine it will not consider itself out of stock until all items in storage have been sold
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.trader.item.3: Can be used to Sell, Purchase, or Barter items with other players
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.trader.item.ar: Can be used to Sell, Purchase, or Barter armor pieces with other players
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.trader.item.bo: Can be used to Sell, Purchase, or Barter books with other players
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.trader.item.ti: Can be used to Sell, Purchase, or Barter tickets and ticket materials with other players
A master ticket is required in order to sell tickets
Tickets being sold can consume ticket materials from storage to print a new ticket for the customer
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.trader.network: Can be used to Sell, Purchase, or Barter items with other players
Accessible from any location via the Trading Terminal
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.trader.open_mu: Edit Basic Settings for All %s Selected Trade(s)
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.trader.paygate: Give Ticket Stubs to the Customer
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.trader.setting: Returns the trader to its item form but retains the trader's current state once the block is placed
Hold SHIFT to keep the trader accessible after pickup
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.trader.slot_ma: Can be used to Sell owner-defined random Items or Money to other players with owner-defined odds of receiving each loot pool
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.upgrade.bank: Allows the Money Chest to automatically deposit or withdraw coins from a selected bank account
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.upgrade.coin_e: Allows the Money Chest to automatically exchange coins upon insertion
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.upgrade.hopper: Allows the block to collect inputs from its neighboring containers
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.upgrade.intera: Increases the number of Traders or Trades that the Trader Interface can interact with by %s
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.upgrade.magnet: Allows the Money Chest to collect coin items up to %sm away
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.upgrade.networ: Makes a trader visible from a trading terminal
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.upgrade.securi: Allows the Money Chest to be protected from destruction by other players
Also blocks container access from other players, but not from automation (i.e. hoppers)
Requires set-up, will not have an owner defined automatically
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.upgrade.speed: Decreases the delay between interactions by %s ticks
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.upgrade.void.1: Makes a trader void all goods purchased from a customer
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.upgrade.void.2: Intended for Admin Use Only to keep pseudo-creative traders from getting full
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.variant_wand.1: Right click on most Lightman's Currency blocks to select a model variant
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.variant_wand.2: Not all blocks have variants by default, but more can be added via resource pack
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.wallet.bank_ac: Can deposit or withdraw coins to/from your bank account in the UI
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.wallet.exchang: Compress Coins to Highest Value Coinage
Can exchange coins manually in the UI
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.wallet.key_bin: Press [%s] while equipped to access your wallet
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.wallet.pickup: Automatically collects any coins that you pick up
Can collect coins up to %sm away
tooltip.lightmanscurrency.wallet.upgrade: Use a [%1$s] on this in your inventory to increase the wallets capacity by %2$s
